value.latex:
Soit $f : {\R^2} \to \R$ de classe $\mathcal{C}^2$.
On pose $g(x,y) = f(2x+y,2x-y)$.
value.html: Soit \(f : {\R^2} \to \R\) de classe \(\mathcal{C}^2\). On pose \(g(x,y) = f(2x+y,2x-y)\).

value.latex:
Calculer les dérivées partielles secondes de $g$ en fonction de celles
    de $f$.
value.html: Calculer les dérivées partielles secondes de \(g\) en fonction de celles de \(f\).

value.latex:
$\frac{\partial^2 g}{\partial x^2} = 4\frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x^2} + 8\frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x \partial y} + 4\frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial y^2}$\par
             $\frac{\partial^2 g}{\partial y^2} =  \frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x^2} - 2\frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x \partial y} +  \frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial y^2}$\par
             $\frac{\partial^2 g}{\partial x \partial y} = 2\frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x^2} - 2\frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial y^2}$.
value.html:
\(\frac{\partial^2 g}{\partial x^2} = 4\frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x^2} + 8\frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x \partial y} + 4\frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial y^2}\)

\(\frac{\partial^2 g}{\partial y^2} = \frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x^2} - 2\frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x \partial y} + \frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial y^2}\)

\(\frac{\partial^2 g}{\partial x \partial y} = 2\frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x^2} - 2\frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial y^2}\).

value.latex: Trouver $f$ telle que $\frac{\partial^2 g}{\partial x^2} - 4\frac{\partial^2 g}{\partial y^2} = 1$.
value.html: Trouver \(f\) telle que \(\frac{\partial^2 g}{\partial x^2} - 4\frac{\partial^2 g}{\partial y^2} = 1\).
